value.description: This error is reserved for customer application use. This will never be returned from any portion of the network stack or HAL.

value.name: EMBER_APPLICATION_ERROR_15
value.description: This error is reserved for customer application use. This will never be returned from any portion of the network stack or HAL.

value.name: EMBER_INCOMING_UNICAST
value.description: Unicast

value.name: EMBER_INCOMING_UNICAST_REPLY
value.description: Unicast reply

value.name: EMBER_INCOMING_MULTICAST
value.description: Multicast

value.name: EMBER_INCOMING_MULTICAST_LOOPBACK
value.description: Multicast sent by the local device

value.name: EMBER_INCOMING_BROADCAST
value.description: Broadcast

value.name: EMBER_INCOMING_BROADCAST_LOOPBACK
value.description: Broadcast sent by the local device.

value.name: EMBER_INCOMING_MANY_TO_ONE_ROUTE_REQUEST
value.description: Many to one route request

value.name: EMBER_APS_OPTION_NONE
value.description: No options

value.name: EMBER_APS_OPTION_ENCRYPTION
value.description: Send the message using APS Encryption, using the Link Key shared with the destination node to encrypt the data at the APS Level.

value.name: EMBER_APS_OPTION_RETRY
value.description: Resend the message using the APS retry mechanism.

value.name: EMBER_APS_OPTION_ENABLE_ROUTE_DISCOVERY
value.description: Causes a route discovery to be initiated if no route to the destination is known.

value.name: EMBER_APS_OPTION_FORCE_ROUTE_DISCOVERY
value.description: Causes a route discovery to be initiated even if one is known.

value.name: EMBER_APS_OPTION_SOURCE_EUI64
value.description: Include the source EUI64 in the network frame.

value.name: EMBER_APS_OPTION_DESTINATION_EUI64
value.description: Include the destination EUI64 in the network frame

value.name: EMBER_APS_OPTION_ENABLE_ADDRESS_DISCOVERY
value.description: Send a ZDO request to discover the node ID of the destination, if it is not already know.

value.name: EMBER_APS_OPTION_POLL_RESPONSE
value.description: Reserved

value.name: EMBER_APS_OPTION_ZDO_RESPONSE_REQUIRED
value.description: This incoming message is a ZDO request not handled by the EmberZNet stack, and the application is responsible for sending a ZDO response. This flag is used only when the ZDO is configured to have requests handled by the application. See the EZSP_CONFIG_APPLICATION_ZDO_FLAGS configuration parameter for more information.

value.name: EMBER_APS_OPTION_FRAGMENT
value.description: This message is part of a fragmented message. This option may only be set for unicasts. The groupId field gives the index of this fragment in the low-order byte. If the low-order byte is zero this is the first fragment and the high-order byte contains the number of fragments in the message.

value.name: EMBER_UNKNOWN_DEVICE
value.description: Device is not joined

value.name: EMBER_COORDINATOR
value.description: Will relay messages and can act as a parent to other nodes.

value.name: EMBER_ROUTER
value.description: Will relay messages and can act as a parent to other nodes.

value.name: EMBER_END_DEVICE
value.description: Communicates only with its parent and will not relay messages.

value.name: EMBER_SLEEPY_END_DEVICE
value.description: An end device whose radio can be turned off to save power. The application must poll to receive messages.

value.name: EMBER_MOBILE_END_DEVICE
value.description: A sleepy end device that can move through the network.

value.name: EZSP_ENERGY_SCAN
value.description: An energy scan scans each channel for its RSSI value.

value.name: EZSP_ACTIVE_SCAN
value.description: An active scan scans each channel for available networks.

value.name: EMBER_STANDARD_SECURITY_MODE
value.description: This enables ZigBee Standard Security on the node.

value.name: EMBER_DISTRIBUTED_TRUST_CENTER_MODE
value.description: This enables Distributed Trust Center Mode for the device forming the network. (Previously known as EMBER_NO_TRUST_CENTER_MODE)

value.name: EMBER_TRUST_CENTER_GLOBAL_LINK_KEY
value.description: This enables a Global Link Key for the Trust Center. All nodes will share the same Trust Center Link Key

value.name: EMBER_PRECONFIGURED_NETWORK_KEY_MODE
value.description: This enables devices that perform MAC Association with a pre-configured Network Key to join the network. It is only set on the Trust Center.

value.name: EMBER_TRUST_CENTER_USES_HASHED_LINK_KEY
value.description: This denotes that the preconfiguredKey is not the actual Link Key but a Secret Key known only to the Trust Center. It is hashed with the IEEE Address of the destination device in order to create the actual Link Key used in encryption. This is bit is only used by the Trust Center. The joining device need not set this.

value.name: EMBER_HAVE_PRECONFIGURED_KEY
value.description: This denotes that the preconfiguredKey element has valid data that should be used to configure the initial security state.

value.name: EMBER_HAVE_NETWORK_KEY
value.description: This denotes that the networkKey element has valid data that should be used to configure the initial security state.

value.name: EMBER_GET_LINK_KEY_WHEN_JOINING
value.description: This denotes to a joining node that it should attempt to acquire a Trust Center Link Key during joining. This is only necessary if the device does not have a pre-configured key.

value.name: EMBER_REQUIRE_ENCRYPTED_KEY
value.description: This denotes that a joining device should only accept an encrypted network key from the Trust Center (using its preconfigured key). A key sent in-the-clear by the Trust Center will be rejected and the join will fail. This option is only valid when utilizing a pre-configured key.

value.name: EMBER_NO_FRAME_COUNTER_RESET
value.description: This denotes whether the device should NOT reset its outgoing frame counters (both NWK and APS) when ::emberSetInitialSecurityState() is called. Normally it is advised to reset the frame counter before joining a new network. However in cases where a device is joining to the same network a again (but not using ::emberRejoinNetwork()) it should keep the NWK and APS frame counters stored in its tokens.

value.name: EMBER_GET_PRECONFIGURED_KEY_FROM_INSTALL_CODE
value.description: This denotes that the device should obtain its preconfigured key from an installation code stored in the manufacturing token. The token contains a value that will be hashed to obtain the actual preconfigured key. If that token is not valid, then the call to emberSetInitialSecurityState() will fail.

value.name: EMBER_HAVE_TRUST_CENTER_EUI64
value.description: This denotes that the ::EmberInitialSecurityState::preconfiguredTrustCenterEui64 has a value in it containing the trust center EUI64. The device will only join a network and accept commands from a trust center with that EUI64. Normally this bit is NOT set, and the EUI64 of the trust center is learned during the join process. When commissioning a device to join onto an existing network, which is using a trust center, and without sending any messages, this bit must be set and the field ::EmberInitialSecurityState::preconfiguredTrustCenterEui64 must be populated with the appropriate EUI64.

value.name: EMBER_TRUST_CENTER_LINK_KEY
value.description: A shared key between the Trust Center and a device.

value.name: EMBER_TRUST_CENTER_MASTER_KEY
value.description: A shared secret used for deriving keys between the Trust Center and a device

value.name: EMBER_CURRENT_NETWORK_KEY
value.description: The current active Network Key used by all devices in the network.

value.name: EMBER_NEXT_NETWORK_KEY
value.description: The alternate Network Key that was previously in use, or the newer key that will be switched to.

value.name: EMBER_APPLICATION_LINK_KEY
value.description: An Application Link Key shared with another (non-Trust Center) device.

value.name: EMBER_APPLICATION_MASTER_KEY
value.description: An Application Master Key shared secret used to derive an Application Link Key.

value.name: EMBER_KEY_HAS_SEQUENCE_NUMBER
value.description: The key has a sequence number associated with it.

value.name: EMBER_KEY_HAS_OUTGOING_FRAME_COUNTER
value.description: The key has an outgoing frame counter associated with it.

value.name: EMBER_KEY_HAS_INCOMING_FRAME_COUNTER
value.description: The key has an incoming frame counter associated with it.

value.name: EMBER_KEY_HAS_PARTNER_EUI64
value.description: The key has a Partner IEEE address associated with it.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_MAC_RX_BROADCAST
value.description: The MAC received a broadcast

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_MAC_TX_BROADCAST
value.description: The MAC transmitted a broadcast

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_MAC_RX_UNICAST
value.description: The MAC received a unicast

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_MAC_TX_UNICAST_SUCCESS
value.description: The MAC successfully transmitted a unicast.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_MAC_TX_UNICAST_RETRY
value.description: The MAC retried a unicast

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_MAC_TX_UNICAST_FAILED
value.description: The MAC unsuccessfully transmitted a unicast.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_APS_DATA_RX_BROADCAST
value.description: The APS layer received a data broadcast.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_APS_DATA_TX_BROADCAST
value.description: The APS layer transmitted a data broadcast.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_APS_DATA_RX_UNICAST
value.description: The APS layer received a data unicast.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_APS_DATA_TX_UNICAST_SUCCESS
value.description: The APS layer successfully transmitted a data unicast.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_APS_DATA_TX_UNICAST_RETRY
value.description: The APS layer retried a data unicast.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_APS_DATA_TX_UNICAST_FAILED
value.description: The APS layer unsuccessfully transmitted a data unicast.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_ROUTE_DISCOVERY_INITIATED
value.description: The network layer successfully submitted a new route discovery to the MAC.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_NEIGHBOR_ADDED
value.description: An entry was added to the neighbor table.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_NEIGHBOR_REMOVED
value.description: An entry was removed from the neighbor table.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_NEIGHBOR_STALE
value.description: A neighbor table entry became stale because it had not been heard from.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_JOIN_INDICATION
value.description: A node joined or rejoined to the network via this node.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_CHILD_REMOVED
value.description: An entry was removed from the child table.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_ASH_OVERFLOW_ERROR
value.description: EZSP-UART only. An overflow error occurred in the UART

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_ASH_FRAMING_ERROR
value.description: EZSP-UART only. A framing error occurred in the UART

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_ASH_OVERRUN_ERROR
value.description: EZSP-UART only. An overrun error occurred in the UART

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_NWK_FRAME_COUNTER_FAILURE
value.description: A message was dropped at the network layer because the NWK frame counter was not higher than the last message seen from that source.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_APS_FRAME_COUNTER_FAILURE
value.description: A message was dropped at the APS layer because the APS frame counter was not higher than the last message seen from that source.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_UTILITY
value.description: Utility counter for general debugging use.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_APS_LINK_KEY_NOT_AUTHORIZED
value.description: A message was dropped at the APS layer because it had APS encryption but the key associated with the sender has not been authenticated, and thus the key is not authorized for use in APS data messages.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_NWK_DECRYPTION_FAILURE
value.description: A NWK encrypted message was received but dropped because decryption failed.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_APS_DECRYPTION_FAILURE
value.description: An APS encrypted message was received but dropped because decryption failed.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_ALLOCATE_PACKET_BUFFER_FAILURE
value.description: The number of times we failed to allocate a set of linked packet buffers. This doesn't necessarily mean that the packet buffer count was 0 at the time, but that the number requested was greater than the number free.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_RELAYED_UNICAST
value.description: The number of relayed unicast packets.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_TYPE_COUNT
value.description: A placeholder giving the number of Ember counter types.
